comment: Very textbook heavy. A lot of different opinions and views. Do not take this class if you are sensitive to controversial political or social topics. Overall if you really enjoy sociology, you'll love this class but not my cup of tea. He will make sure you are participating and will call you out for the readings each week.  HEAVY group projects.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Timothy is great. He listens to students opinions & does well to take constructive criticism when need be. (optional) students who miss class do a paper (super easy) & they get a 100 for attendance. a ton of extra credit at that he gives you time to complete. Even w/ racist students in our class, he held his composer, & remained unbiased

Said multiple sexist things such as, in reference to whether or not women could be "alpha" (ew), something along the lines of, "Well, you didn't see women working on the railroads did you?". He doesn't understand how implicit bias could also apply to him, despite teaching the concept. Your grade is mostly group work. Just not for me.

All work is done in groups. Professor Williams called people out to make sure the weekly reading was done. He really enjoys calling people out. Half the time, it's unknown what he means or what he is talking about. There were not that many grades. The final "essay" is the only thing that wasn't group work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU HAVE OPINIONS. This class is a joke. I was targeted for views he assumed I had. Got so bad his bias was dropping my grade, despite my participation. Encouraged my group in class to shut me up by threatening their grades. Double-standards galore! Called me a freak, literally. Stood up for myself and he did not like it.
100% recommend this class if you are not overly sensitive and dramatic about occurring events or topics in the world. Really chill teacher! Do the bare minimum and you will pass!!

He's the type to call on people in class and ask what you read so if you don't like reading or being called on don't take his class. Everything is group work including quizzes, essays, and even the final exam. He's cool sometimes but very critical if you don't answer the way he wants you to.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: This class is an absolute joke. You are in groups of 5ish. Everything is group work. He says he doesn't believe in "busy work", but he assigns a ton of work. There are 20 vocab q's that have to be answered in paragraphs with citations and 3 or 4 chapter q's WEEKLY. This is on top of a bunch of presentation work. He doesn't know what he is doing.
